description: Numbers n such that every genus of binary quadratic forms of discriminant -4n consists of a single class and the class number h(-4n) = 4.
references: David A. Cox, "Primes of the Form x^2 + n y^2", Wiley, 1989, p. 60.
G. B. Mathews, Theory of Numbers, Chelsea, no date, p. 263.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
